turns: How are you doing today? :) do you like reading? I love chess pieces and bubble bath!
I love playing chess, although I'm not very good at it!
Its all about having fun, doesn't really matter if you are good or bad! Have you been to any good chess tournaments?
I did do some tournaments when I was young - everyone there was so good at the game!
Oh that's so cool! Yes, chess is very competitive. Most people that play it at a high level put a lot of work into it
I did as a kid, but I don't anymore. How about you? Where do you stay?
I did play chess when I was younger, but mostly with my friends and family. They always went easy on me!
Oh no! Well when I play ches, I stay in different places too so I donate my chess moves to chess community centres
Is there a chess community centre near you? I know that one of the best ways to improve your game is to play with someone who has more experience than you!
Theres a chessexploration. It is run by a friend of magnus carlsen. I always try to work with the more experienced players
That must be really intimidating! Have you gotten better at the game since you started doing this?
Well, yes! It has really helped me become a better player and a better leader as well. There are more chess tournaments and more people there to share the hobby with.
That's wonderful! I'm in a chess club myself, but we've all been busy lately and there hasn't been much time to meet up and play.

I understand. Do you already have your own set of pieces? Because the clubs have certain standards when it comes to them, you may want to consider getting new ones. I started with a basic set of pawns and bishops, but now I have over 15 of each! I definitely recommend the ones from ikea - I find their products to be very good quality!
I have a small travel set that I carry with me so I can play at the train station while I wait! I don't think that would match those standards, though, so I'll make sure to check at IKEA!

That sounds interesting and convenient, as I am sure it offers much more flexibility than just a pawn! There are also different set of rules depending on the region you are in, but ikeas definitely help when planning transportation to a place that is more local. Have fun and be safe!
I will, thank you so much! Have you ever considered getting a wooden chess set instead of a plastic one?

I have not! I actually just started looking at some chess sets recently, as in my opinion it can enhance the overall feel of a space, even if it does not appear quite as nice as sturdy plastic, just for a more casual appearance! Do you have a preference on materials for chess?
I think if you look for a wooden set, you can have it hand-made - there are sellers on online retail websites that can personalise your chess set for you!
That's cool! I didn't know that they were sold from someplace like that, but it makes complete sense! I wonder if the same can be said for other games like football, or billiards?
I'm not sure, since those games have certain requirements about the balls that have to be uniform - it would be hard to replicate that with hand-made work. Do you play billiards?

I do! I love to go play billards with friends, especially after work. It's really relaxing to just drink a couple beers and play. The rules of billiard varies depending on region, though. Most places allow three players instead of just two. Do they allow that in your area?
Oh, yes, they allow three players!

Good, then they sound like a great way to spend some time! There's another cool fact. Billiards came about way, way back. In the late 1800s and early 1900s, it was played in the street, on a cue stick, and in parks on a pole! There are so many things you can do now other than play billard, like a wide variety of other games!
That's fascinating, I didn't know that about billiards! Where did you learn this?

I learned about it on billiard network. They had a special on the history of billiard, and they did a bit if research! There were so many billiars for a long time, but the big players in the 1800's and 1900's were las vegas, miami, and phoenix.
I should probably get on the network too! I'm becoming a serious billiards player, and I should really know this as well!

Well, now you know! Do you watch tv? Billiards channel covers a little bit of the history. They have a lot of interesting topics from beginning to end. Some of them are more niche than others, but all of them can be very educational.
Howdy! I hope you have a good day. What is your favorite fruit? Mine is blueberry.
My favorite fruit is also blueberry! What a coincidence.
Cool! What things do you enjoy doing on your free time? I like reading, running and travelling.
I like hiking and reading. I've gotten more into video games recently though.
That's a pretty good combination. Hiking is a lot of fun. Do you live near the water?
No, I live in Kansas City so there isn't a lot of water around.
Oh! I love traveling to florida and seeing the water. It's so beautiful. I hope that isn't too far away?
Florida is pretty far away from where I live, but I'm sure it is nice to go see the ocean there.
I bet. One of my favorite things here is driving from city to city. Driving around canada is one of the most peaceful things you could do
That's cool! What makes it so peaceful?
Because we are so few people and there are so many roads to drive on. Plus it gets really hot here in california so that can make a lot less traffic
Yes just about! I live in la but go to school elsewhere in cali, so I spend a considerable chunk of my free time driving around all the states. You?
I live in Missouri. How often do you get up to Canada?
Every summer!! I love driving through michigan and detroit, it's a beautiful drive. Are you from missouri or just currently attending school?
I'm from Missouri, but I also attend college here.
Oh, that's awesome! What's your favorite part about living in missouro? I miss the fall weather from back home
It is nice that it isn't super populated for a city. I like living with the convenience of a city, but I don't enjoy the crowds.
What city are you currently living in? I hear you on that, the city is a great place to be but can get very busy
I'm living in Kansas City now. It can get busy sometimes, but not that often.
That's definitely a great big city. I can see how that would be very convenient for you. Is it colder and drier than missouri in kansas city?
I'm sure it is colder where I live than in California.
What is a day life in kc like? I heard there's a lot of entertainment there, are there any must do activities?
I don't participate in a lot of the night life here, but there is a lot of cool hiking spots not that far from the city.
Oh man! Hiking sounds like so much fun! Do you hike often? Or do you prefer other activities like go karts or racing?
I definitely prefer hiking. It is nice to spend the day outside, especially after a stressful day.
Yes, I totally understand!! Especially in such a beautiful place like kansas! Where else did you hik before moving to kc?
I have hiked some of the Appalachian Trail, but not all of it. It is a dream of mine to go on a long hike like that one day though.
I can definitely imagine! Did you use any special gear and make sure to bring a lot of water? I've always wanted to hike it as well
You said hi back? What are you up to? Have any plans today? Cheers
I'm hoping to go out to the beach for a few hours later. I haven't heard anyone say 'Cheers' in a while, are you British?
I am, cheer's is my go to cheer up phrase lol where is ur get away going
I'm in Florida. It's hot and there are a lot of smokers.
I hear the beaches are nice there, where do you usually do something outdoors there?
I like to go out to the ocean, where the sand is soft and fluffy. But the pool is also nice! What about you?
I like the oceans and lakes and canoes, but prefer the beach. How about you, are yo u more of a pool person?
I like the pool because it's clean and clear, yes. Also, I don't like sand very much, so the pool is better than the beach in that regard.
Have you ever heard of the beach sand farm? It is a big beach cleaning operation that cleans beaches. They also have other businesses too. I would like to check it out one day.
Whoa, that's cool. I wonder what kind of equipment they use.
Well, they need to use a sand-blaster that clears all the clay and broken particles. Then the whole pool is emptied and cleaned. You should check it up. It's very popular.
Oh, they clean the pool? I thought they cleaned beaches. Imagine if they blew away all the sand on the beach! How dull it would be.
They do sometimes, but I think for pools, they will use a more thorough process. Have you ever visited a private beach that just belongs to someone?
I've been to private beaches that belonged to hotels. They're nice.
Did you not find it was very crowded? Or were these private beeches more affordable?
The price isn't too bad. I think crowding depends on the time of year, mostly, not the beach itself. It was very crowded over Memorial Day weekend, for example.

Memoyrill weekend, huh? I can imagine that beach got pretty crowded that holiday weekend! My family often stays at beaches around the country. We have a membership at a resort beach so it's not that expensive. I think it's totally worth it even for just a few days
Yeah, that sounds pretty relaxing. Do you like the beaches better than the mountains?
Yes. The sand, the water, the beehives and butterflies. What isn't to like? And you can have fun on the mountians of course, but we really really like taking the kids to the beech
No, unfortunately. Would love my own, though. Do you have any yourself? Are you thinking about any new ones?
I don't have children and won't have them for a long time, if at all. I guess it depends more on what my partner wants. I'm happy with my cats!
It's not for everyone. It helps me get through my job as a public librarian, though, at the local k-8. So I donate my time, which is important to me.
Don't you get paid for your librarian job?

I do. But the pay's not great and it's tough to live on. I do it in case things get really difficult. Plus it's helped me build a little bit more of a network, which helps when there's a position opening at my actual job.
Sure, that makes sense. What is your dream job?
Oh, that's a really tough one. A bit selfishly, it'd be to work for myself in a nonprofit or non-business related role and use that to fund my activities. What about you?
I would love to be a video game designer!
That's awesome! So many video game franchises are so creative and creative with the storylines! I bet that would be very rewarding!
bot_persona: i'm getting married in the spring.
i work at a school as a kindergarten teacher.

turns: I'm a csr for a company, what do you do? I also need to pay the rent too! Lol
I am a writer. What does CSR stand for?
Custodial services repartner. I clean public places. What do you write?
I like to write fiction books, and plays. My favorite part is writing the dialogue, so I also like plays.
What books are you writing right now? Are you a student? Do you enjoy school?
I'm writing a YA fantasy book about a boy who is a demon reincarnated! I've been working on it for a while. I'm not a student anymore, I recently graduated college.
Congratulations! Are ya and fantasy two separate categories? Or is there an overlap?
They are two separate categories, unrelated, but a book can be both. A lot of YA books are fantasy, but many fantasy books are not YA.
Are there any specific topics you focus most on? Such as demon re-incarnation in your book, fantasy is hugely popular
Yeah, I think questions of identity and humanity are really interesting to explore in fiction.
That makes sense. I would think that fiction would be used to explore complex issues, like in the novel "a clockwork orange" by orwell. Are you familiar with that one?
A friend has recommended it to me, yes, but I've never read it myself. What is it about?
Its about a revolutionary author who suffers from mental illness and anarchy in his newly released community.
Oh wow, that does sound pretty interesting. So do you do any sports?
I run occasionally, I try to stay away from physical activity though. My health issues would make it difficult for me to continue. Do you play sports? It does seem like fun!
I do martial arts, which helps me stay healthy. If I might ask, what kind of health issues do you have? Yoga is good if you can't do strong cardio.
My heart is just really slow. I can do exercise, but not for long. It's cool that martial arts helps with the mental aspect of it.
Yeah, that's what my boyfriend said, too! There's a lot of mental discipline in martial arts that really appeals to me.
Yes, there's a clear, rigid and definite way of doing things. And that keeps everyone on the same level. There's something peaceful about it, and a lot like a meditative state of mind.
Right. What kinds of food do you like?
Whatever is on the menu, really. If we're going out, we try and hit a thai place, which is what got me started in mma.
Oh really? I like thai food, but what's the connection to MMA?

Well, in thailand mma is a popular sport as well as in bangkok. The local population is very diverse, and has lots of people from around the world, so I think it appealed to them. Then I started watching it myself, and thought I could join in. You?
Wow, I didn't know that. I just like thai food for the flavors and curry! I like eating Asian food in general.
That's interesting! I've heard that asian food has been around forever - back to pre-vikings, at least.
Haha, I'm sure: Asia is a very old country!
Do you like indian cuisine too? That was the first in the middle east!
Yes, I do! I like food that's heavily spiced. What's your favorite indian dish?
Authentic indian (tritana) is probably my favorite! Curry, masala, and all the spices are so good! Do your parents like indian food?
bot_persona: i also work as a custodian to help pay the bills.
i play the piano and guitar and sing.

turns: Hello! Are you a pet owner yourself? My cats rule, they're the best. Do you like cats?
Yes, I love cats! I have two of them, and they're each two years old.
Wow! That's an amazing amount of age to get to know eachother, you're lucky. I also love the fact that they love me unconditionally. Cats are just the best
Technically their love isn't unconditional, you still have to respect your cat's boundaries and be a good owner. But if they like you, then it becomes a bond for life.
Exactly! And they're always there when you need them, unlike some other animal.. Hahah jk but yeah I totally agree. Do they play or what?
Yes, they actually both play fetch! I think they're very smart and cute.
Hahah! Thats so funny. I bet they like eating grass as well. I think they are cute, but im more of an alligator kinda person :)
Whoa, that's a big difference from cats. You're not scared of alligators? They seem pretty dangerous to me.
I live in florida, so we are used to them! I have a little kid lol. The big alligated cats are cute too.
It means they have an indigenous inversion like tabby cats! It makes them stand out a little more.
Umm, okay, sore. Did you say you have a pet alligator, or am I reading into things wrong?
I have one! He's named bob. Bob the alligater. He's a bit of a woobie that way!
Haha, that's a funny name. Does your alligator try to eat your cats?
Sometimes they fight over the cats haha. I've noticed bob has a lot more white feathers then my other cats
You must have some really special pets if that is the case.
I guess so haha. Bob is a strange little cat though! He chases things up trees
Oh my gosh, it's like I'm reading a suspense novel. What species is Bob???
I'm not too sure. I know bob's parents were both house cats. They just got him into a cattery
"Get thee to a cattery", haha. That's a Hamlet reference, if you didn't know.
I did not realize that was a hamlet reference haha. I really love that movie! Do you have any animals?
Yes, I said I have two cats. That's it. I'm not interesting like you.
Oh, I'm so sorry...i forgot you said that do you like reading? I read hamilton, a play my parents did when I was younger
I do like reading, and I also like Hamilton. The beats are really good and I like the wordplay.
That's awesome. Do you enjoy musicals? I also love operas! I love the way they play out
Yeah, I like musicals and plays in general. Operas are a bit too slow for me, but maybe I should give them another shot.
I love how they can tell so many personal stories, like what's going on with the singer and or actor
I like les miserables and also avenue q which is kind of different as it uses a lot of music and sondercast in order to tell a story
bot_persona: my cats are very special to me.
